page.title: 18POPULATION OF EDGEFIELD
page.content: The population statistics for Edgefield show considerable variations and provide a sidelight on the agricultural history of the area. Two hundred years ago the area held nearly twice as many people, but in the agricultural depression of the 19th century many left to seek work elsewhere. In the 1830s there was mass emigration to America: on one occasion a sixth of the total population went, about 130 people. Some also went to Australia, and recently a family now living there has been trying to trace descendants of the relatives left behind 150 years ago. Now for the most part new people in the village tend to be pensioners, attracted by North Norfolk's dry climate and its reputation for long-lived inhabitants.
